titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn aerial views and 1939 World's Fair photographs V1987.051
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T15:12-0500

did.unittitle: Brooklyn aerial views and 1939 World's Fair photographs

physdesc.extent: in one folder and one oversize box.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: The Brooklyn Historical Society also holds the following related collections:

list.item: New York World's Fair collection, ARC.077; and
Williamsburgh Savings Bank building, 1 Hanson Place collection, ARC.116.

relatedmaterial.p: Consult with library staff for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Brooklyn aerial views and 1939 World's Fair photographs date from 1939 to circa 1980 and contain 25 items. Photographic formats include black-and-white prints and contact sheets. Images in the collection show the 1939 World's Fair, based in the Flushing neighborhood of Queens, with photographs of theatrical productions, corporate exhibition buildings, and the fair grounds. The collection also includes aerial photographs of Downtown Brooklyn and the Fort Greene neighborhood of Brooklyn, taken from the Williamsburgh Savings Bank building in Fort Greene.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Based on the date range of this collection, all items in the collection will enter the public domain by 2100. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn aerial views and 1939 World's Fair photographs, V1987.051, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.
